result.execSummary:
The defendant Tabatha Lee Comas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tabatha Lee Comas in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial today.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing and restitution hearing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tabatha Lee Comas in court with attorney Jeff Schwarz for Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Araiza is in trial and unable to appear.  The defendant advised the Court that she'd like new counsel.  Court advised the defendant that this will be addressed when attorney Araiza is present.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on September 9, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Tabatha Lee Comas in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tabatha Lee Comas in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Family Dollar Store on W. Greenfield Ave.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tabatha Lee Comas in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/8/15 @ 1:30pm
